intro: Pleomele congesta, commonly known as the clustered flaxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Pandanaceae and is characterized by its rosette-like growth habit with fleshy, strap-shaped leaves. Pleomele congesta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas.
